Login.Name: Name
Login.Save: Save authorization data and use it in the future.
Login.ApiKey Info: This application makes requests to NASA's open API during its operation. To authorize users, a special key is required, which you can get at
Login.DemoKey Info: If for some reason you do not want to register, then you still can use this application, however, the API has a limit on the number of requests and you can only make 25 requests from one IP address per day. You can check the number of remaining requests on the profile page.

Search.No photos: No photos for such parameters, create new or try another query
Search.First time: Create search query using left panel

About.First: This project was created as part of the course work by M.A. Drobyshev, a student of the Institute of Information Technologies of Chelyabinsk State University.
About.Second: This application allows you to search and view photos from NASA rovers at Mars. To create a search query, select the rover, the instrument from which we want to get the image and the date Photo. The appendix also provides background information about rovers.
About.Third: The following libraries and dependencies were used to create the project: React, redux-toolkit, Material UI, i18n. The main technical features of the project are support for two languages, lazy loading photos, the ability to authorize users and save data about users in the browser's local storage.
About.Fourth: Using the Electron library.js based on the application, a desktop application distribution for the Windows platform has been created.

Error.User message: An error occurred when accessing the server, it looks like you are using the wrong key or the request limit has been exceeded.
